availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jetson Moore (Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret P. Gregory Moore in Washington County, Kentucky, on October 27, 1834. Father of Thomas P. Moore, John L. Moore, James M. Moore, and Susan Elizabeth Moore. Farmer in Washington County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Washington County in 1850. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Washington County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Washington County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, p. 198 A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, p. 509 A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 61-62.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 470 A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, Film #000551244.
"Jetson Moore (1810-1861)," Find A Grave, Memorial #57971185, accessed September 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57971185.
